messages.subject: Re: graphic artist in the house
messages.msgSnippet: HP offers a wide variety of free classes 24/7, read online, then use message boards to communicate with the instructor and other students.
messages.messageBody:
HP offers a wide variety of free classes 24/7, read online, then use
message boards to communicate with the instructor and other students.

http://h30187.www3.hp.com/index.jsp

No one cares how old people are - sometimes they tell me and sometimes
not. :) I've had 8 year olds and 88 year olds in classes.

CNET also offers some nice classes and I see they have some digital
photography and graphics classes right now. That's not my area! :)

http://www.cnet.com/2001-11311_1-0.html

Take care, c.

--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, "tracy" <tracyliebmann@...>
wrote:
>
> Hi~
> My DD (10+) is really taking off with her web skills and is
interested
> in all Graphic type learning. Has anyone studied graphic arts
online,
> she has photoshop 5 and has figured alot out on her own. There was a
> cont. ed class offered at a local college, but they said she needed
to
> be 16+ so I started looking for other options.
>
> Has anyone had any experience with this, she has out grown my
> knowledge already!!! Yikes!
> Thanks~ Tracy in SC
>

messages.subject: graphic artist in the house
messages.msgSnippet: Hi~ My DD (10+) is really taking off with her web skills and is interested in all Graphic type learning. Has anyone studied graphic arts online, she has
messages.messageBody:
Hi~
My DD (10+) is really taking off with her web skills and is interested
in all Graphic type learning. Has anyone studied graphic arts online,
she has photoshop 5 and has figured alot out on her own. There was a
cont. ed class offered at a local college, but they said she needed to
be 16+ so I started looking for other options.

Has anyone had any experience with this, she has out grown my
knowledge already!!! Yikes!
Thanks~ Tracy in SC
